result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Faith M. Meiners was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Faith M. Meiners was found guilty of Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: With huber privileges (WAIVED first 48 hours), with good time.  DE has 84 days credit if probation revoked unless stipulation filed.
Undergo any psychological evaluation deemed appropriate by agent.

Provide DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent.  Not to possess controlled substances w/o valid prescription and must notify agent w/in 48 hours if one is received.  Not to go to taverns/bars or business where primary purpose of business is sale of alcohol or drug paraphernalia.  Absolute Sobriety.  Random UAs.  No operation of m/v w/o valid DL.

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt: from DE to Br 2

Defendant Faith M. Meiners in court, in custody.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and State states appearances.  Motion by State to vacate huber privileges.  DE explains why she feels her work release privileges should be reinstated.  Atty Albrecht responds requesting work release privileges for a reasonable time due to violations re: controlled substances.  DE responds/thinks 60 day revocation is fair.  Court admonishes DE and orders huber privileges be disallowed for four months effective date huber was first revoked.  After that there would be no EMP and DE would have to remain in the jail.

Both parties recv'd and reviewed PSI.  State gives recommendation of 5 years prison (2 yrs. IC/3 yrs. ES).  Atty. ORourke gives recomm. of going with what agent recommends impose & stay 2 yrs I.C./3 yrs ES probation 3 years, 6 mos. jail and Count 3:10 days jail & court costs.  84 days credit.  DE makes allocuation.  Court admonishes DE.  Court imposes sentence.
